text: I've actually been in a proper spacesuit
when I went up in the US Air Force you
to spy plane a few years ago if the
airplane went wrong the pressurized
system failed or the canopy blew off you
would be relying on the spacesuit to
pressurize you and feed you oxygen and
make you survive otherwise you would
boil away in a few minutes
has anybody out there ever been on an
airliner or any form of aeroplane that
is decompressed because it's extremely
rare but it can happen which is why you
have the oxygen mask that will fall down
in front of your face and it can be
attached by the two rubber bands behind
your head please secure your own oxygen
mask before helping other people it is
fascinating to see how little atmosphere
there actually is and how much it has
achieved as a sort of bang for buck
ratio the atmosphere scores better than
pretty much anything else we've got it's
this tiny little fog of air above the
earth for five or six kilometers and
everything that's happened on the earth
and that hasn't happened on the other
planets in the solar system is because
of that that's all it is okay so here's
a question if all the air in the
atmosphere was condensed into the form
of water how deep would the puddle be
covering all the landmass on earth so
that is a bit of a confusing question
but you get the gist of it basically if
you turn the atmosphere into water how
deep would it be
